Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that multiple politicians and government officials around the world have died from COVID-19.
Understate: The claim understates the number of politicians who have died from the virus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is ample evidence of politicians dying from COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that no politicians have been affected by the virus, which is a problematic assumption given the evidence to the contrary.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that politicians have indeed died from COVID-19.
